thread.title: Rare, stinky 'corpse flower' blooms in Chicago
thread.title_full: Rare, stinky 'corpse flower' blooms in Chicago

author: Guessy1
title: Rare, stinky 'corpse flower' blooms in Chicago
text:
CNN Leadership
Rare, stinky corpse flower is blooming in Chicago Botanic Garden Updated 2315 GMT (0615 HKT) September 29, 2015 6 photos: Alice the corpse flower is blooming Alice the corpse flower, also known as Amorphophallus titanium, is blooming at the Chicago Botanic Garden . Hide Caption 6 photos: Alice the corpse flower is blooming The rare corpse flower blooms every several years, and there's no predictable blooming schedule. Hide Caption 6 photos: Alice the corpse flower is blooming When it does bloom, it gets very (very) stinky. Hide Caption 3 of 6 6 photos: Alice the corpse flower is blooming Clearly, some people seem to like--or at least don't mind--the smell of Alice, which is designed to attract bugs that pollinate the plant. Hide Caption 4 of 6 6 photos: Alice the corpse flower is blooming Alice will be in bloom at the Chicago Botanic Garden for the next 24 to 36 hours. Hide Caption 5 of 6 6 photos: Alice the corpse flower is blooming Those who can't make it to Chicago at the last minute can watch the flower live on YouTube . Hide Caption
